results.title: Teenagers talk: getting through adolescence
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Presents teenagers from various ethnic backgrounds commenting on the difficulties of being an adolescent. Uses animated sequences to visually express such topics as sex, parents, drugs, peer pressure, individuality, conformity, friendship and physical maturation.
results.description: Presents teenagers from various ethnic backgrounds commenting on the difficulties of being an adolescent. Uses animated sequences to visually express such topics as sex, parents, drugs, peer pressure, individuality, conformity, friendship and physical maturation.

results.title: Teenagers on trial
results.creator_credit: Frances Dinsmoor and RKO Pathe Pictures
results.brief_description: During the emergence of the “angry young man” stereotype in the 1950’s, this classroom film attempted to instruct the young on the evils of non-conformity and rebellion. By addressing such a complex issue in 8 minutes, the film’s main purpose was to promote discussion. Shows examples of various types of juvenile delinquency and makes a shallow attempt to illustrate some of the causes including crowded schools, negligent parents and tenement neighbourhoods.

results.title: Teenagers create an animated film
results.creator_credit: Larry Eikleberry, Maurice Prather and Centron Educational Films
results.brief_description: Documents the efforts of junior high school students in producing an animated film, “Gone with the antennas”. Shows the step-by-step process of how an animated film can be produced with a minimum of expense by a youthful group.

results.title: Teenage whiz kids
results.creator_credit: Arthur Mokin Productions and CBS News
results.brief_description:
A CBS News presentation, this film views some gifted children in Washington. Covers the following points regarding gifted children: early entry into tertiary education, emotional maturity, the attitudes of peers, parents, and teachers and the types of problems encountered with early entry to universities and the resultant support needed.
Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: Teenage pregnancy
results.creator_credit: Hector Lemieux, Joe Hayward, Moreland-Latchford Productions and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: Shows the reaction of a family when one of the daughters reveals that she is pregnant. Presents the decisions to be made concerning both the mother-to-be and the coming child, ignoring the responsibility of the father and concentrating on the girl’s problem.

results.title: Teenage movies in competition
results.brief_description: Contains excerpts from twelve award-winning films made by young filmmakers “out to communicate ideas…to make a personal statement… to examine a civic problem…to educate or just to have fun.” All films submitted for the “Teenage Movies Competition” run by Kodak.

results.title: Teenage Babylon
results.brief_description: Restaging 1950s and 1960s forensic photographs, director Graeme Wood explores the meanings, memories and possible stories that were undetected at the time. These intimate and poetic portraits reveal how the distance of time itself alters and reconfigures the actual space and meaning of the photograph.
